content.description: Start in the cave on the left side of the wall. The block in the cave is on for feet, hands start on the jug undercling. Make a big move, use a kneebar or other trickery, and throw a heel up to top it out.

climbs.name: Pinch Me I Must Be Greening

content.description: Sit start with a good left hand pinch and a sloping wider right hand pinch. Climb sloping shelfs and quartz blocks to the top.
content.location: This climbs the left boulder of the two short boulders just up the hill from Green Mountain Gringo/The Green Egg.

content.description: Hard sit start off a rock that includes both a heelhook and toehook. Start with a right hand on a flaky gaston and left on a sloping edge. Climb up and left, finishing above the small cave of Tractor Pull.
content.location: Just outside of and left of the the Dead End cave.

content.description: Start as low as you can on an edge and slopey crimp with a foot around the corner to the left. Pulling on will you make you dab on the rock on the ground but just pull past it til your established. Go left to a crimp rail then match it and go up left to a bad crimp and right to a good incut crimp in the middle of the face.Â
content.location: In between Herniator and Tractor Pull

content.description: Sit Start on the left side of the small overhang with two flat edges. Climb up and right using good flat holds on the right and toping out at the highest point on the right.
content.location: This is the right boulder of the two small boulders in the alcove just up the hill from the Green Mountain Gringo/The Green Egg.

content.description:
Great seam in a dabilicous cave. Start as far back in the cave as you can while still being able to access the seam. Huge sloping feet with comfortable, but small, crimps lead you out and right to a somewhat desperate move to the corner and up the arete.

 The start is on the two heinous crimps all the way to the left - try not to cheat the start by starting in the wider slot just right of the crimps.
content.location: Uphill from the Green Cave look for a few small boulders on the right. Up and back is the cave that comes to a dead end.

pathTokens: Boulders Behind the Main Parking Lot/Visitor Center

content.description: A little cave and dirty boulder
